question:
Identify the personality with the help of given information:
  1. He was an Indian revolutionary fighter
  2. He founded the India House and the Indian Sociologist journal
  3. He became the first non-Brahmin to receive the prestigious title of Pandit by the Pandits of Kashi in 1877
  4. He was a disciple of Swami Dayanand Saraswati and propagated the teachings of the Vedas
   Select the correct answer from options given below:
explanation: Shyamji Krishna Varma was an Indian revolutionary fighter. India House of London was set up by Shyamji Krishna Varma and the journal The Indian Sociologist was also published by him. In the year 1877, he became the first non-Brahmin to receive the prestigious title of Pandit by the Pandits of Kashi. He was a disciple of Swami Dayanand Saraswati and propagated the teachings of the Vedas. Shyamji Krishna Varma is the correct answer.
